intro: Lavatera minoricensis, commonly known as the Minorca lavatera, is a flowering plant native to the island of Minorca in the Balearic Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh maritime climate. Its foliage is often hairy, providing a protective layer against salt spray and wind.
